abstract: Intel is leading an initiative to add jobs and spur innovation to keep the U.S. ahead of nations like China and India.
snippet: Intel is leading an initiative to add jobs and spur innovation to keep the U.S. ahead of nations like China and India.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Technologists have been worrying aloud for years that America is losing its competitive edge as other countries invest more heavily in technology education and innovation.

headline.main: A $3.5 Billion Effort Aims to Help Tech Start-Ups
headline.print_headline: Fearful the U.S. Is Slipping, a $3.5 Billion Effort Aims to Help Tech Start-Ups

abstract: Intel and 24 venture capital firms said Tuesday that they planned to invest $3.5 billion in American start-ups over the next two years in an effort to keep America competitive in technology education and innovation, The New York Times reported.
snippet: Intel and 24 venture capital firms said Tuesday that they planned to invest $3.5 billion in American start-ups over the next two years in an effort to keep America competitive in technology education and innovation, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Technologists have been worrying aloud for years that America is losing its competitive edge as other countries invest more heavily in technology education and innovation.

headline.main: A $3.5 Billion Effort Aims to Help Tech Start-Ups

abstract: A deal announced a year ago between Intel and TSMC has failed to result in new products, highlighting Intel’s problems at getting into the consumer electronics game.
snippet: A deal announced a year ago between Intel and TSMC has failed to result in new products, highlighting Intel’s problems at getting into the consumer electronics game.
lead_paragraph: About this time last year, Intel and TSMC announced a groundbreaking deal. Intel, which loves to make its own chips, tapped TSMC, which loves to make chips for other companies, to make variants of its Atom processor.

headline.main: A Tie-Up Between Intel and TSMC Fizzles
